item.title: Why Must Debugging Be Done by Yourself
item.description: If someone points out where your program is wrong, you won’t gain any insight, and you may repeat the same mistake next time. This is because the errors you discover through extensive debugging leave a deeper impression. Debugging ability is a key measure of a coder’s productivity and can enhance your capacity to write high-quality, bug-free code. This leads me to think about the steps of debuggingâ€”not just to fix the issue, but also to push myself to delve deeper.
